Name: UR Ticketing System
Description: This web-based application addresses the critical need for timely building maintenance by implementing an issue tracking ticket system, akin to those used in IT services, specifically tailored for building upkeep. While the code is lost, project documentation remains available.

Name: UR Advisor
Description: A university class registration, advising, and grade-viewing application streamlining student input while offering a comprehensive overview of academic progress and aiding in future class planning. Although the code is lost, project documentation remains intact.

Name: Pokémon Space World Demo to PK2
Description: My first publicly released application, developed using C++, is a command-line tool that simplifies the preservation of extracted Pokémon data from the Pokémon Space World Demo. It streamlines the repair process for incomplete data, to a straightforward drag-and-drop action. This functionality has been integrated into PKX Extraction for ongoing usability and code maintenance.

Name: School Manager
Description: Developed during ICT 710, this desktop application enables users to efficiently create, load, edit, and manage student information pertinent to educational institutions.

Name: Rock Blaster
Description: Crafted during Unity experimentation, this game presents a simple yet enjoyable experience. Players navigate a space environment, shooting asteroids in a basic rail shooter format.

Name: Notes Website
Description: Produced during ICT 713, this web-based application allows users to create, store, and organize notes in an SQL database. Users can categorize notes by type and easily filter to locate specific entries.

Name: Contact-Organizer
Description: Created during ICT 712, this desktop application enables users to manage contact lists, offering functions to add, remove, and edit contacts. Data storage options include JSON files or SQL databases.

Name: Store-Project
Description: Developed during ICT 711, this desktop program efficiently tracks employee sales, inventory, and store transactions, storing data in a JSON file. Built with C# and .NET.

Name: Portfolio Website
Description: I created a personal website to showcase my academic, career, and personal achievements, providing visitors with insights into my diverse endeavors and accomplishments.

Name: Game Clock
Description: This Fitbit watch face, inspired by Persona 5, features a clock displaying the hour, minute, second, day, month, and year. It also includes a battery meter for convenient charge monitoring.

Name: PKX Extraction
Description: This application extracts Pokémon data from RAM dumps, enabling users to uncover hidden game aspects, recover lost data, conduct research on RAM-stored information, and preserve invaluable game data.

Name: Invoice Transfer System
Description: This project, undertaken during ICT 714, involves creating a Windows Forms App that utilizes database transactions. Developed using the database-first approach and Entity Framework, the software enables users to select an invoice and view all invoices associated with the same payee. Additionally, users can transfer funds between these invoices.

Name: PK Injection
Description: Launching in June 2024, this application addresses the challenge posed by Pokémon games with significant modifications that render them uneditable by standard Pokémon save editing software. This utility finds and applies edits directly to Pokémon in RAM, it bypasses the limitations encountered by conventional save editors when modifying this data.
